data.title: Fine food, ambiance and service
data.text: Very very nice updated food beverage and room. Service spot on with good advice. Craft cocktails nicely done. Convenient location right on Independence Square perfect for a Truman visit. Small plates available if you don't want to eat a heavy meal. A very pleasing experience after a day of sightseeing.

data.title: Best Dinner of our Road Trip
data.text: We were on a two week road trip and had the most amazing dinner  at Ophelia's.  My husband and I both agreed that our dinners there were without compare.  This was the third  restaurant  we experienced in the square of Independence.  The others were fine but our dinner at Ophelia's was hard to forget.  I had the  fried chicken dinner  and my husband had a steak.  Zack, our waiter, was friendly and efficient.  The setting is beautiful.  Modern, sleek and clean. Wish we lived closer so we could become regulars.  It was a very nice dinner experience!

data.title: Best fine-dining around.
data.text:
Quaint restaurant on the square in Independence, MO.
Service, food, and atmosphere are tops. 
One of our very favorite for all special occasions.

data.title: You will be stuffed
data.text: Celebrated a friend's birthday here as part of the trip to independence to see the Bingham Waggoner Museum.  I love that they still take reservations. The Sunday brunch had a nice variety of salads, breakfast items and dinner items, along with a beautiful desert bar. The interior is a bit dark, but overall a very enjoyable experience.

data.title: Amazing food/atmosphere/wait staff/location..... I can't say enough about this restaurant!
data.text: We were on a quest to eat somewhere we have never tried before. We just happened to be in Independence,Mo. and wanted something that had a variety of choices for lunch. We decided that Ophelia's was the winner. And, boy, what a good choice this was. My daughter and I had the half club sandwich with the Caesar salad, and my husband had the Ophelia's Cuban sandwich. The flavors just exploded in our mouth. We weren't rushed and enjoyed every bite. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone for a wonderful meal.

data.title: Cool downtown restaurant!
data.text:
After our tour of the Truman Library, we drove to the downtown area looking for a restaurant for a late lunch and found Ophelia's.  We were very well pleased!

The building is a restored place with lots of light and interesting nooks.  Tables are placed apart enough that you can have a private conversation.  The lunch menu offered items that looked like dinner options alongside regular luncheon-type choices.  We chose burgers, but my side was asparagus.  The burgers were perfectly cooked.

We lingered over lunch, looking out the window to a beautiful view of small-town Americana.  It'll be worth the drive, trust me!

data.title: Very nice place
data.text: My niece had her Wedding reception here Sept 24 2016. the room was beautiful the food was very yummy. the staff was nice they did a good job when asked a question and keeping our drinks full.

data.title: Great food!!
data.text: This quaint restaurant is located in historic area of Independence.  Delicious food and great service!  Would recommend for couples, family or large groups.  We had a large group and they were accommodating.  I ordered the seafood special (Grilled Salmon) and asked for a different side dish in substitute to the special and again, very accommodating without hassle.  Would definitely dine here again!

data.title: Fine place to Dine
data.text: My husband and I always enjoy the historic Independence Square and this restaurant makes the experience sweeter. Friendly service and fantastic food. Expect the chef to impress!

data.title: Very good lunch
data.text: A friend and I were in Old Independence one day, on other business. We decided to stop somewhere for lunch. I had read about Ophelia's so we went there. Had sandwiches and small salads. Very nice. Good service and nice surroundings.

data.title: surprising for the small town of Independence
data.text: I didn't expect the quality of food and service in a town like Independence.  I was in the area for roughly two weeks before stopping in and was far from impressed with the area until I dined at this restaurant.  The food was amazing, service was perfect, and wine was quality.  I suggest going to this place on half price wine night because they have some nice wines by the glass as well as by the bottle.

data.title: Dinner ouy
data.text: Found to be very nice. Food was great and the service was excellent. Piano was a nice touch. Very enjoying evening out. Highly recommend

data.title: Food tasty, service lacking
data.text: Had the salmon and salad which was tasty. My food experience has always been positive but service the last few times has been terribly slow and unfriendly. Very pricey for a below average experience.

data.title: Great dining experience
data.text: We have had Sunday brunch, lunch and dinner at this restaurant and thoroughly enjoy each meal.  The Sunday brunch has so many selections and the omelet station is great.  No complaints on lunch or dinner and enjoy the staff who remember you and take good care of you.

data.title: Ray is the best.
data.text: Great brunch.  I also love the dinners here.  The scallops are awesome as well as the steaks.  Love the lamb and the shrimp tempura apps.

data.title: Must try!
data.text: Across the street from the historical courthouse, my wife and I stayed here Saturday night while in town on a little weekend getaway...service and food for dinner were great and the Sunday brunch buffet was even better!  We stayed in one of the rooms on the second floor and were very pleased with the accommodations as well...highly recommended!

data.title: delicious food, but pricey
data.text: Easily could be a $40 lunch for two.  Will say that the food has always been delicious and tasty.  Had dry fish only one time...seemed overcooked.

data.title: Yes Amazing
data.text: We went here based on reviews and WOW!    Probably the best food that I have eaten in this area, including the plaza area.   Had the Brunch, and it is the only buffet style meal that I sent every used plate back empty.    Everything that I ate that day was amazing.   I was full and was going to skip desert until my wife let me try her blueberry bread pudding.   Okay it was so good, I had to go get some of my own.    Do not miss this restaurant!

data.title: Date night
data.text:
We had an early dinner and wine on a Wednesday night. The atmosphere is very nice, great wine, good service and the food was delicious. 
I had stuffed salmon and my husband had the chicken shrimp pasta. Both were excellent and more than enough. We had a dinner salad and bread. The bread is served with three kinds of butter.
We WILL go back. There is a piano in the dining area, would love to go back when someone is playing.

data.title: Fabulous food
data.text:
We have eaten here on several special occasions, the most recent was a birthday.  The meals we had were as follows:
Berkshire Tomahawk Chop
Sweet balsamic brushed pork chop, garlic whipped potatoes, pan-fried Brussel sprouts, American Honey bacon glaze, crispy shallots.
Chateaubriand
Beef tenderloin filled with Gorgonzola cheese and sliced portobello mushrooms, grilled asparagus, garlic whipped potatoes, port wine butter sauce 
Grilled Norwegian Salmon
Seasonal risotto, charred asparagus, blistered local baby heirloom tomatoes, sweet citrus butter 

Each dish was fabulous  - everything was perfectly cooked to order.  Service is great and the restaurant is a romantic get away.
For desert we had the Creme Brule and an amazing chocolate sampler plate.  Portions were large enough to share.
